Package org.cpnsim.request

Interface Instance

All Superinterfaces:
ChangeableId, Identifiable, RequestEntity
All Known Implementing Classes:
InstanceSimple
public interface Instance extends RequestEntity
Instances run on the host, and each instance occupies the host's resources, including CPU, memory, storage, and bandwidth.
Since:
LGDCloudSim 1.0
Author:
Jiawen Liu

  • Method Details

    • getCpu

      int getCpu()
      Get the CPU required by the instance to run on the host. The default unit is Core.
      Returns:
      the CPU required by the instance.

    • setCpu

      Instance setCpu(int cpu)
      Set the CPU required by the instance to run on the host. The default unit is Core.
      Parameters:
      cpu - the CPU required by the instance.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.

    • getRam

      int getRam()
      Get the memory required by the instance to run on the host. The default unit is GB.
      Returns:
      the memory required by the instance.

    • getBw

      int getBw()
      Get the bandwidth required by the instance running on the host. The default unit is GB.
      Returns:
      the bandwidth required by the instance running on the host.

    • setBw

      Instance setBw(int bw)
      Set the bandwidth required by the instance running on the host. The default unit is Mbps.
      Parameters:
      bw - the bandwidth required by the instance running on the host. The default unit is Mbps.
      Returns:
      the instance itself

    • getLifecycle

      int getLifecycle()
      Get the lifecycle of the instance running on the host. The unit is milliseconds.
      Returns:
      the lifecycle of the instance.

    • setLifecycle

      Instance setLifecycle(int lifecycle)
      Set the lifecycle of the instance running on the host.The unit is milliseconds. If the lifecycle is set to -1, the instance will never finish running.
      Parameters:
      lifecycle - the lifecycle of the instance.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.

    • getInstanceGroup

      InstanceGroup getInstanceGroup()

      Returns:
      the instance group to which the instance belongs.

      Parameters:
      instanceGroup - the instance group to which the instance belongs
      Returns:
      the instance itself

    • isSetDestHost

      boolean isSetDestHost()
      You can specify the scheduled hostId for the instance in advance. If it is specified, the system does not need to find the host to be scheduled for the instance. Get whether the hostId to which the instance is to be scheduled is specified.
      Returns:
      whether the hostId to which the instance is to be scheduled is specified

    • setDestHostId

      Instance setDestHostId(int destHost)
      Set the hostId to which the instance is to be scheduled.
      Parameters:
      destHost - the host to which the instance is to be scheduled
      Returns:
      the host to which the instance is to be scheduled

    • getRetryMaxNum

      int getRetryMaxNum()
      Get the maximum number of retries for the instance.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of retries for the instance.

    • setRetryMaxNum

      Instance setRetryMaxNum(int retryMaxNum)
      Set the maximum number of retries for the instance.
      Parameters:
      retryMaxNum - the maximum number of retries for the instance.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.

    • addRetryNum

      Instance addRetryNum()
      Add the number of retries for the instance. If the number of retries exceeds the maximum number of retries, the instance is marked as failed. Eg: If the maximum number of retries is 0, the instance is marked as failed after the first scheduling failure. If the maximum number of retries is 3, the instance is marked as failed after 3 retries. It means that the instance has been scheduled 4 times.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.

    • getRetryNum

      int getRetryNum()
      Get the number of retries for the instance.
      Returns:
      the number of retries for the instance.

    • setRetryNum

      Instance setRetryNum(int retryNum)
      Set the number of retries for the instance directly.
      Parameters:
      retryNum - the number of retries for the instance.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.

    • addRetryHostId

      Instance addRetryHostId(int hostId)
      Add the hostId to the list of hostIds that the instance has retried. So that we can record the hostIds that the instance has retried.
      Parameters:
      hostId - the hostId to be added to the list of hostIds that the instance has retried.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.

    • getRetryHostIds

      List<Integer> getRetryHostIds()
      Get the list of hostIds that the instance has retried.
      Returns:
      the list of hostIds that the instance has retried.

    • isFailed

      boolean isFailed()
      Get whether the instance is marked as failed.
      Returns:
      whether the instance is marked as failed.

    • getExpectedScheduleHostId

      int getExpectedScheduleHostId()
      The scheduled hostId for the instance after intra-scheduling or inter-scheduling is specified in the expectedScheduleHostId.
      Returns:
      the user request to which the instance belongs.

    • setExpectedScheduleHostId

      Instance setExpectedScheduleHostId(int expectedScheduleHostId)
      Set the scheduled hostId for the instance after intra-scheduling or inter-scheduling.
      Parameters:
      expectedScheduleHostId - the scheduled hostId for the instance after intra-scheduling or inter-scheduling.
      Returns:
      the instance itself.
